metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7515 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
poppler through version 0.55.0 is vulnerable to an uncontrolled recursion in pdfunite resulting into potential denial-of-service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> possibly only affects CLI tool, so may not have any security impact.

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5').
